intro: Linanthastrum, commonly known as the desert star, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. They are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Linanthastrum species are typically shrubs or subshrubs with succulent leaves that help them conserve water. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
